title: How often does the classmates change in your batch?
content:
For a CSE student in 1st semester, does the class get completely shuffled next semester, and even though it is department-wise from second year, will it be according to SRN or completely randomised and shuffled

Can I expect to at least know who will be in my class next semester or it's the same people or it is completely randomised and shuffled?

comments.body:
Classes from 3rd sem are permanent ones, it's usually SRN wise. 
From 1st to 2nd sem you can expect some changes provided they had different batches for kcet people and all.

Here is a way to find out who will be there in your class from 3rd sem onwards- roughly 60 students per class sorted on the basis of srn, so cs001- cs060 will be in the same class, cs061-cs120 will be in the same class and so on. 
This almost holds exactly -/+5 usually. 
In addition to these there will be a few branch change and lateral entry students as well.

Thanks for answering. Do the classes change again for 4th sem because some people joined from ec campus. My class has more than 60 students now. So they won't start over and order based on srn considering the ec students? The ec students have srn like 900+ so they won't be shifted to a new class? Thanks again.
